summary.para: A message pump calls this method to see if any messages should be redirected to the Component Object Model (COM) object.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: A message should be redirected to the COM object. The application should call with this message.
The menu has exited the menu mode and can be destroyed.

remarks.para: If this method returns S_OK, the message loop should not call or .

summary.para: Translates a message for a Component Object Model (COM) object.

param.name: pmsg
param.para: A pointer to an structure that contains the incoming message.

param.name: plRet
param.para: A pointer to the translated message.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

description.para: The message was handled and should be deleted.
The message was not handled. In this case, *plRet is NULL.

remarks.para: Typically, is called before this method. The parent window proc, not the message pump, must call IMenuBand.TranslateMenuMessage for every message.
This method can change the values of pmsg. If so, the changes should be forwarded on.
This method is required because some modal message pumps do not allow a call to a custom translation method.
